newsitem.title: TURKEY: Iran's Velayati in Turkey for talks.
newsitem.headline: Iran's Velayati in Turkey for talks.

text.p: Iranian Foreign Minister Ali Akbar Velayati arrived in Turkey on Monday for talks aimed partly at defusing a diplomatic row between the neighbouring Moslem countries.

"I know that both countries are determined to put an end to the crisis," Velayati told reporters at Ankara airport when asked about a dispute that has resulted in diplomats from both countries returning home.
It began when Ankara protested about Iranian ambassador Mohammed Reza Bagheri's presence at an Islamist rally in Ankara in January. Bagheri has since left Turkey.
Last week, Tehran ordered Turkey's ambassador and another Turkish diplomat in the western city of Orumiyeh to leave Iran.
Velayati said Tehran welcomed a Turkish envoy's visit to Iran earlier this month aimed at calming the situation.

"My visit to Turkey is the second positive step between the two countries...two Moslem friendly countries," he said. "Of course in the past we have had fluctuations, but with the wisdom which exists in both countries we could overcome difficulties in our relations," Velayati said.
Diplomatic relations between Iran and its secularist neighbour have often been strained but the expulsions created the first row since an Islamist-led government came to power in Ankara last June.
Velayati said he was to invite Turkish President Suleyman Demirel to a summit of the Organisation of the Islamic Conference, being held in Tehran in December.
He was also to meet Foreign Minister Tansu Ciller and Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan before leaving Turkey on Tuesday.
Velayati began a 10-day tour with a trip to Damascus on Sunday and was also to visit Sudan, Uganda, the Czech Republic and Gulf Arab states, including Saudi Arabia.
